comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content:
Timber staddler ... or stacker?

This is a machine used to moved and stack grouped lengths of timber in a commercial timber yard.  The sides of the recess underneath the driver can be squeezed together by hydraulic power to grip, lift or lower and move the bale of timber.

comment.author: 76189276@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Slow Transportation, and we'd love to have this gem added to the group!

comment.author: 23460011@N02
comment._content: Ok, after some poking around I think the answer is B) Straddler, 'Saddler' being a typo. I actually found another one referred to as a 'Straddle Truck' industrialphotos.industrialartifactsreview.com/photos_08_... Thanks for picking up the mistake everyone, I will adjust our records accordingly.
